Andrew & Tracy are having a wedding

We're glad to have you here to check out updates for our wedding festivities. We'll be adding some site functionality including maps, a registry link, and more day-of details.

About Andrew & Tracy

Andrew Metell

Born June 12, 1977 in the state of Georgia, Andrew spent most of his life growing up in Keene, NH. He is known for his love of disc golf, politics, and Tracy. Andrew is currently working on getting the website up and running, playing disc golf, learning programming, and enjoying cooking.

Andrew & Tracy

Tracy and Andy first communicated Sept 5th, 2013, and first met Sept 15th, 2013. Their first date is fondly referred to as "The park bench" as they sat and talked for hours, so delighted to be in each other's presence.

Tracy & Andy were first engaged under an American Sycamore tree in Brattleboro, VT. They married in Keene, NH on June 6th, 2016, and are now ready to have a wedding ceremony.

Tracy Bartella-Metell

Born January 30, 1985 in Oneida, NY, Tracy is excited to share with you the beautiful landscape she explored in childhood that you'll look upon from Best View Barn. When not consumed with details of wedding planning, Tracy is training at TFW Keene, spending time outdoors, learning to become a more technical Technical Analyst, and enjoying life with Andrew.

The Best View Barn

 4846 Brown Rd
Munnsville, NY 13409

Food by Zeinas

Cocktail hour appetizers and reception dinner will be Lebanese-style Mediterranean, provided by the friendly Zeinas family, who run a cafe in Utica, NY. When trying out the cafe cuisine, Andrew and Tracy found them to be a humor-filled, warm-natured, and sincere family.

We are sure there will be something tasty for everyone!

Dessert will be provided in part by Zeina’s. This is your chance to try chocolate humus, delicious as a dip for cut fruit (or anything really)! We’ll also have an assortment of fresh fruit pies, provisioned from North Star Orchards, in Westmoreland, NY.

THIS & THAT ABOUT OUR WEDDING

WHAT TO WEAR?

  • Our ceremony is outdoors, but we'll be inside if it pours
  • Fall weather in NY is variable, check the forecast for zip 13421
  • Attire: Autumn dress, slacks or skirt with shirt, khakis & polo
  • Formal is welcome if you feel fancy!
  • Remember heels are not the best footwear for lawns

WHERE TO STAY?

La Quinta Inn & Suites Verona           Microtel Inn & Suites by Wyndham
5394 Willow Pl, Verona, NY 13478      5118 NY, NY-365 Verona, NY 13478
Phone: (315) 231-5080                     Phone: (315) 367-2018

These are the closest hotels (22 mins) to our venue. They are not blocking rooms. Check out Syracuse, off Thruway exit 35 from points westward or Utica, off exit 31 points eastward for more (45 mins).

Also feel free to Airbnb--It's worked well for us!!

To find the venue, we suggest Google/Apple maps and look for signs along the route, day of.

IN TOWN SATURDAY?

Join us for dinner Saturday, September 22nd from 4-7 at:

Verona Beach State Park
6541 Lakeshore Rd S
Verona Beach, NY 13162

Follow your nose to the BBQ in the South Shelter.

Dinner will be hot out of the smokehouse by Limp Lizard Lounge of Liverpool, NY. We’ll have plenty of non-alcoholic drinks to quench your thirst. For anyone that wants to start the celebrating early, NY State Parks allow BYOB.

Early fall merriment!
